shell.controlled_unit_tooltip: This unit has been opened by a Controller

common.name: Name
common.password_confirmation_required_descripti: Please confirm your password to proceed
common.automated_tooltip: This item is managed by the system and cannot be modified.

error.invalid_host: Invalid host: must be a hostname or an IP address
error.mac_already_reserved: MAC address has already been reserved
error.ip_already_reserved: IP address already has a reservation
error.invalid_ip_v4_address_or_cidr: Enter a valid IPv4 address with optional CIDR notation
error.invalid_ip_address_or_cidr: Enter a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address, with optional CIDR notation
error.invalid_address: Enter a valid IP address with optional CIDR notation, MAC address, hostname, or fully qualified domain name
error.invalid_cidr_v4_address: Enter a valid IPv4 address with CIDR notation
error.invalid_cidr_v6_address: Enter a valid IPv6 address with CIDR notation
error.invalid_cidr_address: Enter a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address with CIDR notation
error.invalid_fqdn: Enter a valid fully qualified domain name
error.invalid_ip_address_or_fqdn: Enter a valid IP address or fully qualified domain name
error.invalid_port_or_port_range: Enter a valid port or port range
error.invalid_uci_name: Only letters, numbers and underscore (_) are allowed
error.invalid_alphanumeric_starting_with_lette: Only letters and numbers are allowed, starting with a letter
error.invalid_alphanumeric: Only letters and numbers are allowed
error.invalid_lease_time_duration: Lease time must be at least 2 minutes
error.invalid_future_date: Date cannot be set in the past
error.invalid_ip_v4_mtu: Enter an integer number between 576 and 9200
error.invalid_ip_v6_mtu: Enter an integer number between 1280 and 9200
error.invalid_vlan_id: Enter an integer number between 1 and 4094
error.invalid_metric: Enter an integer number greater than or equal to 0
error.invalid_negative_integer: Enter an integer number greater than or equal to 0
error.empty_network_device_description: There must be at least an unassigned device or a device with role 'hotspot'
error.password_lowercase_required: Password must contain at least one lowercase letter
error.password_uppercase_required: Password must contain at least one uppercase letter
error.password_number_required: Password must contain at least one number
error.password_special_character_required: Password must contain at least one special character
error.invalid_dns_forwarding: Enter a valid IP address or DNS forwarding item
error.start_must_be_greater_then_end: Start must be greater than end
error.upload_file_migration: Uploaded file is not a valid migration archive
error.last_must_be_greater_than_first: Ensure that the last IP in the range is greater than the first IP
error.cannot_retrieve_zones_for_device_configu: Cannot retrieve zones for device configuration
error.reserved_ip_must_be_in_server_network: Reserved IP must be in server network
error.cannot_enable_or_disable_firewall_rule: Cannot enable or disable firewall rule
error.backup_passphrase_decryption_failed: Decryption failed: passphrase may be incorrect
error.backup_passphrase_restore_failed: Restore failed: passphrase may be required or backup file may be invalid
error.invalid_ipaddr: One or more records are invalid
error.empty_domains: One or more domains are empty
error.invalid_domains: One or more domains are invalid
error.total_chars_exceeded: There are too many domains. Please remove some and include them in a new domain set.
error.loop_detected: Loop detected: a host set cannot contain itself
error.domain_set_conflict: Domain set cannot be used as both source and destination
error.certificate_already_requested: A certificate for this domain has been already requested
error.end_must_be_greater_then_start: IP end must be greater than start
error.start_reserved: First IP of network is reserved
error.cannot_retrieve_ovpn_traffic_by_hour: Cannot retrieve OpenVPN traffic by hour
error.cannot_retrieve_connected_client_by_hour: Cannot retrieve connected clients by hour
error.cannot_retrieve_client_traffic_by_hour: Cannot retrieve client traffic by hour
error.network_conflict: This name is already in use by another network interface
error.cannot_retrieve_latency_and_quality_repo: Cannot retrieve latency and quality report
error.dhcp_range_cannot_contain_interface: The firewall IP address must be outside the DHCP range.
error.cannot_reuse_old_password: New password must be different from the old one

ne_combobox.limited_options_label: Continue typing to show more options

ne_file_input.dropzone_label: Drag and drop or click to upload

ne_dropdown_filter.more_options_hidden: Continue typing to show more options

login.welcome_description_standalone: Sign in to {product}, secure your network and access the cloud quickly.
login.welcome_description_controller: {product} Controller allows you to manage your {product} units quickly and easily.

wizard.setup_wizard_description: This wizard will guide you through the initial setup of your unit and help you establish a secure configuration.
wizard.welcome_description: It is recommended to perform this setup while the {product} unit is disconnected from the internet.
wizard.secure_by_default_description: Apply a secure-by-default configuration to ensure your firewall unit is safely set up right from the start.
wizard.tailored_configuration_description: Change the root password, configure SSH, and manage access to the unit.
wizard.quick_setup_description: Complete the setup in just a few minutes
wizard.change_root_password_description: Changing the default root password is essential to prevent unauthorized access and protect your network. The new credentials will be applied immediately before proceeding to the next step.
wizard.password_suggestion_6: For stronger security, 14 or more characters are recommended
wizard.ssh_access_description: Secure SSH access by disabling password-based root login. This reduces the risk of unauthorized access and strengthens overall system security.
wizard.ssh_key_required_for_access_description: Password login for the root user is disabled. To enable SSH access, make sure to upload your SSH public key to the unit.
wizard.web_access_9090_title: Web interface access on TCP port 9090
wizard.web_access_9090_description: Configure access settings for the web interface on port 9090. By default, access is enabled from the LAN.
wizard.web_access_443_title: Web interface and WAN access on TCP port 443
wizard.web_access_443_description: Configure access settings for the web interface and WAN access on port 443.
wizard.web_interface_service_on_tcp_port_443: Web interface service on TCP port 443
wizard.summary_description: Review the configuration summary before applying the changes. If you need to make any adjustments, click 'Back' to return to the previous steps.
wizard.root_password_saved_successfully: Root password has been saved successfully
wizard.web_access_form_wan_limited: Web access from WAN may be limited
wizard.web_access_form_wan_limited_description: Access to the web interface from the WAN could be limited depending on your current configuration. If you are connected via port 443 or 9090, you might lose access after applying the changes. Make sure your settings align with your access requirements.
wizard.wan_access_port_443_warning_title: WAN access on TCP port 443 disabled
wizard.wan_access_port_443_warning_description: As a result, reverse proxies will not function.

netify_informatics.title: Netify Informatics
netify_informatics.content_description: Netify Informatics is a third-party cloud service that utilizes analytics and AI to convert local DPI metadata obtained from NethSecurity into high-level network intelligence. Enable metadata sending and save the configuration. Copy the Agent UUID, then access Netify site and proceed with provision agent wizard.
netify_informatics.metadata_sending: Send flow metadata to Netify Informatics
netify_informatics.enable_metadata_sending: Make sure to enable metadata sending before provisioning the agent

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.default_hostname_warning: Using the default hostname 'NethSec' is not recommended. Change it in {systemSettingsLink} and apply the change.
dashboard.blocked_ips_last_hour: IPs blocked in the last hour
dashboard.dns_not_configured_tooltip: You're using one or more WANs with a static IP: make sure to configure at least one DNS forwarder. Go to {dnsLink}
dashboard.monitoring_disabled_tooltip: Enable logging on at least one chain to enable threats monitoring. Go to {page}

subscription.title: Subscription
subscription.unit_subscription_description: Paste here your authentication token to enable the subscription.
subscription.remote_support_description: Only available for specific subscription plans.
subscription.invalid_secret_or_server_not_found: Invalid token or server not found
subscription.confirm_cancel_subscription: If you cancel the unit subscription you will lose access to the extra features included in your plan. These may include
subscription.unlimited_controlled_units: Unlimited units to be managed from a registered controller
subscription.sync_not_attempted_description: Since last boot the unit haven't attempted to sync with remote portal. You can force a sync by clicking on the button 'Sync now' below.
subscription.sync_error_description: The unit is unable to sync with remote portal. Check your internet connection and try again.

system_settings.title: System settings
system_settings.default_hostname_description: Using the default hostname 'NethSec' is not recommended. You can assign a different hostname to this unit here.

ssh_access.description: SSH network shell access and integrated SCP server
ssh_access.title: SSH Access
ssh_access.allow_root_login_with_password: Allow the root user to login with password
ssh_access.allow_remote_host_connection: Allow remote hosts to connect to local SSH forwarded ports
ssh_access.tcp_port_too_low: TCP port must be greater than 1
ssh_access.tcp_port_too_high: TCP port must be less than 65535

ssh_keys.description: Public keys allow for passwordless SSH logins with a higher security compared to the use of plain passwords
ssh_keys.title: SSH Keys

delete_key_modal.title: Delete SSH key
delete_key_modal.body: Do you really want to delete the following SSH key?

backup.title: Backup
backup.description: Download current settings and data of your unit. This will be a safeguard against potential data loss or system failures.
backup.description_subscription: Configure a passphrase to enable encrypted backups. The system automatically manages up to 10 encrypted backups.
backup.passphrase_helper: Enter a passphrase if you want to encrypt the backup with GPG; if the passphrase is empty, the backup will be saved in plain text. Warning: if you lose the passphrase, you won't be able to use the encrypted backup.
backup.passphrase_reser_helper: Enter an empty string to remove passphrase
backup.run_backup_description: A backup of '{name}' will be created.
backup.modal_delete_description: Are you sure you want to delete '{name}' backup?
backup.configure_passphrase_to_run: Configure passphrase to start run encrypted backups
backup.backups_require_a_passphrase: Backups require a passphrase to be stored.
backup.the_system_will_automatically_create_bac: The system will automatically create backups, or you can start one manually by clicking "Run cloud backup".
backup.passphrase_required_for_restore_descript: The passphrase you set will be required to decrypt your backups during the restore process. Make sure to store it securely, as it cannot be recovered.
backup.passphrase_update_applies_to_new_backups: Passphrase update applies to new backups
backup.changing_your_passphrase_applies_to_new_: Changing your passphrase will only affect future backups. To restore older backups, you must use the passphrase that was set at the time of their creation.
backup.remove_passphrase_description: Remove the backup passphrase will disable encryption for future backups.
backup.passphrase_configured_description: The passphrase has been configured successfully. It will be used to encrypt future backups.
backup.passphrase_removed_description: The passphrase has been removed successfully. Future backups will not be encrypted.
backup.passphrase_edited_description: The passphrase has been edited successfully. Next backups will be encrypted with the new passphrase.

restore.description: Restore a previous configuration of the unit, ensuring it works with its original rules and parameters.
restore.restore_in_progress: Restoring backup and rebooting the unit, please wait
restore.passphrase_helper: Enter the passphrase used to encrypt the backup, or leave empty if the backup is not encrypted. If the passphrase is incorrect, the backup cannot be restored.

migration.description: Migration is the process to convert a NethServer 7 machine into a NethSecurity. To initiate the process, access the NethServer 7 machine and create a migration archive, which should then be uploaded on this page. Following the upload, ensure the proper remapping of old network interfaces to those within the hardware hosting NethSecurity.
migration.description_link: See the manual for more info.
migration.remap_interfaces_description: During interface remapping, if one or more interfaces change their IP address, you have to login again on the new IP address.
migration.migration_in_progress: Migrating, please wait... At the end, the machine will be reachable from the following IPs:

passphrase.title: Passphrase
passphrase.description: Configure a passphrase to increase the security of your data. The passphrase will be required to restore the backups.

reboot_and_shutdown.title: Reboot and shutdown
reboot_and_shutdown.reboot_description: Restart the unit. The system will be temporarily unavailable during the reboot.
reboot_and_shutdown.shutdown_description: Power off the unit for maintenance, relocation, or decommissioning.
reboot_and_shutdown.shutdown_warning: You are about to power off '{unit}' unit
reboot_and_shutdown.reboot_warning: You are about to reboot '{unit}' unit
reboot_and_shutdown.reboot_in_progress: The unit is rebooting, please wait...
reboot_and_shutdown.reboot_timeout_error: The unit is not responding. Please check the connection and try reloading the page.
reboot_and_shutdown.pending_changes_warning_reboot: There are unsaved changes. They will be lost if the system reboots.
reboot_and_shutdown.pending_changes_warning_shutdown: There are unsaved changes. They will be lost if the system shuts down.

update.title: Updates
update.bug_security_fixes_description: Security and minor bugfixes are distributed using packages.
update.system_update_description: New features are released with images. If a new image is available you can update the system to a new version. Alternatively upload a compatible firmware image.
update.system_update_first_tip: Backup your configuration before updating your {productName} system
update.system_update_second_tip: The current settings and configuration will be preserved
update.bug_security_fixes_to_update: Bug and security fixes to update
update.schedule_mode_tooltip: After the update the unit will reboot
update.system_update_scheduled_description: The system will be updated to '{version}' at {date}
update.cancel_update_description: The scheduled update to version '{version}' will be canceled
update.system_update_in_progress_message: Updating and rebooting unit, please wait...
update.automatic_updates_tooltip: Enable to activate automatic updates. Available only with subscription.
update.connection_error_description: Cannot connect to the update server. Check internet connection and try again.
update.maintenance_description: The update server is under maintenance. Try again later.
update.unauthorized_description: Unauthorized access to the update server. Check your subscription status.
update.server_error_description: The update server appears to have some issues. Try again later.
update.generic_error_description: An error occurred while checking for updates. Try again later.
update.repository_url_not_set_description: The repository URL appears not to be set. Please check the underlying configuration.

storage.title: Storage
storage.description: You can keep a copy of your system logs on an persistent storage such as a USB stick or a SATA drive. This can be useful for troubleshooting problems or for keeping a record of your system activity. If you lack an additional drive, you can alternatively choose the operating system disk if it contains available unpartitioned space; the system will automatically generate a partition and utilize it.
storage.format_storage_warning: All data contained in '{device}' will be erased
storage.new_partition: A new partition will be created on device '{device}'
storage.configure_storage_logs_description: From now on, logs will also be written on the device at the path
storage.configure_storage_extra_data_description: Extra data can be automatically stored to the device once a day
storage.remove_storage_warning: You are about to remove storage '{storage}'. Logs won't be written on the device anymore

factory_reset.title: Factory reset
factory_reset.description: Factory reset erases all installed packages and customized settings, reverting the firewall back to its original state as it was after installation.
factory_reset.description_helper: Factory reset restores the currently installed version.
factory_reset.perform_factory_reset_description: Factory reset permanently erases all data and settings.
factory_reset.resetting_description: Resetting and rebooting the unit, please wait...

certificates.title: Certificates
certificates.description: This page allows the configuration of X.509 certificates used by the Nginx HTTP proxy server. You can either upload a custom certificate or request a Let's Encrypt certificate for secure connections.
certificates.name: Name
certificates.delete_certificate_message: Are you sure you want to delete '{certificate}' certificate? This operation is irreversible.
certificates.validation_method_tooltip: In Standalone mode, the server will be temporary accessible on port 80 during certificate generation. The domains for which you request certificates must be public domain names linked to the firewall's own public IP address. DNS mode enables the use of your DNS provider's API to issue certificates. Unlike standalone mode, the domain name in DNS mode does not need to resolve to the router IP. It is the sole mode supporting wildcard certificates
certificates.dns_api_tooltip: Choose a DNS provider from the list detailed at {dnsapiurl}. Add key-value entries as outlined in the provided link to configure access to the selected DNS provider.
certificates.default_certificate_tooltip: This certificate is served when accessing the firewall using its FQDN
certificates.pending_tooltip: Certificate pending release from the remote server

controller.title: Controller
controller.connect_unit_description: Connect your unit to a remote controller for centralized management. Access the controller to add a unit, then enter the generated join code here. The connection will seamlessly establish within seconds.
controller.unit_name_tooltip: Insert a descriptive name to easily find the unit within the controller. It is good practice to use the firewall FQDN.
controller.controller_join_code_tooltip: Generate join code from controller: add a unit in the controller, copy the generated code, and paste it below.
controller.disconnect_unit_message: The unit will be disconnected from the controller and will no longer be accessible from the controller itself. Do you want to proceed?
controller.connect_unit_message: Unit logs will be transmitted to the Controller for the purposes of storage, monitoring, and analysis of network usage. If you do not wish for this data to leave the device, do not connect to the Controller.
controller.sending_data_to_controller_tooltip: Complete monitoring available on Grafana with NethSecurity {subscription_link}
controller.no_last_sent: Data is being prepared for transmission
controller.unit_description_tooltip: Insert a descriptive text to easily find the unit within the controller. It requires controller version 2.0.0 or later.
controller.settings_updated_description: Description may take up to 15 minutes to change in the Controller. Connection to the Controller will be restarted.

interfaces_and_devices.title: Interfaces and devices
interfaces_and_devices.name: Name
interfaces_and_devices.enter_one_ipv4_or_ipv6_address: Enter at least an IPv4 or an IPv6 address
interfaces_and_devices.enter_ipv4_address: Enter at least an IPv4 address with CIDR notation
interfaces_and_devices.this_interface_is_marked_for_deletion: This interface is marked for deletion
interfaces_and_devices.ipv6_address_tooltip: Enter a valid IPv6 address, or leave the field empty for automatic assignment from the WAN provider. IPv6 assignment length will be automatically configured to 64.
interfaces_and_devices.client_id_label: Client ID to send when requesting DHCP
interfaces_and_devices.vendor_class_label: Vendor class to send when requesting DHCP
interfaces_and_devices.remove_configuration_explanation: Remove '{iface}' configuration? Device '{device}' will become unassigned
interfaces_and_devices.dhcp_hostname_to_send_label: Hostname to send when requesting DHCP
interfaces_and_devices.dhcp_hostname_device: Send the hostname of this device
interfaces_and_devices.select_devices_for_bridge: Select the devices to attach to the bridge
interfaces_and_devices.select_devices_for_bond: Select the devices to attach to the bond
interfaces_and_devices.primary_device_not_included: Primary device must be included in selected devices
interfaces_and_devices.delete_bond_description: Delete bond '{name}'? The devices bonded will be detached and available for other configurations.
interfaces_and_devices.management_ipv4_address_cidr_tooltip: This IP address is for internal use only and won't be the primary address of the bond. Make sure it's not already used in your network
interfaces_and_devices.pppoe_name_too_long_need_reconfiguration: PPPoE interface names are limited to {num} characters. You can remove the configuration from this device, then reconfigure it with a shorter interface name.

multi_wan.title: MultiWAN
multi_wan.policy_description: List of available policies, if there are multiple WANs the default policy is mandatory and cannot be deleted.
multi_wan.ports_tooltip: Enter a single port, multiple ports separated by a comma (e.g. '8686, 9090') or port ranges (e.g. '5500-5600')
multi_wan.sticky_tooltip: Allow traffic from the same source IP address to use same WAN interface as prior session (default timeout: 10 minutes).
multi_wan.rules_description: Routing policies are assigned to hosts via rules. To use a different policy than the default, create a rule and place it above the default rule.
multi_wan.create_policy_before: Please create a policy before continuing
multi_wan.no_hostnames_or_ips: No hostnames or IP addresses tracked by default, click below to add some defaults.
multi_wan.tracking_hostnames_or_ips_description: Enter the IP addresses (or hostnames) to ping to monitor the status of the WANs. If at least one host answers to the ping, the WAN remains active.
multi_wan.ping_settings_description: Configure how control pings are sent. The default values should already fit well most connectivities.
multi_wan.interface_recovery_description: Number of tests needed to enable or disable the single WAN interface.

delete_rule_modal.title: Are you sure you want to delete '{name}' rule?

delete_policy_modal.title: Are you sure you want to delete '{name}' policy?

dns_dhcp.title: DNS and DHCP
dns_dhcp.dns_forwarding_servers_tooltip: Configure upstream DNS server IP addresses to route non-local domain queries to these servers. Enter the IP address of the remote DNS server. Use '/{'<'}domain{'>'}/{'<'}server{'>'}' syntax to route only requests for a specific domain to the given server. Use the '/{'<'}server{'>'}#{'<'}port{'>'}` syntax if the upstream server does not listen on a standard port.
dns_dhcp.dns_domain_tooltip: Local domain suffix added to DHCP names and hosts file entries. Useful if there is a local domain, otherwise it is safe to leave the default value (lan).
dns_dhcp.rebind_protection_tooltip: Filter out addresses from private ranges sent by upstream nameservers. This option can prevent an attack where a browser behind a firewall is  used  to  probe machines on the local network.
dns_dhcp.dns_records_description: Configure DNS records for local IP resolution of specified hosts. Hostnames link domain names to IP addresses. This feature is unnecessary for hostnames with static leases but can be handy for rebinding fully qualified domain names (FQDNs).
dns_dhcp.name: Name
dns_dhcp.wildcard_dns_record_tooltip: When this option is activated, the server will respond to all queries made for this domain and all its subdomains.
dns_dhcp.delete_dns_record_message: You are about to delete DNS record '{name}'
dns_dhcp.static_leases_description: Static leases assign stable IP addresses and symbolic hostnames to DHCP clients. The host is identified by its MAC address, assigned a fixed IP address, and provided with a symbolic hostname for easy recognition.
dns_dhcp.dynamic_leases_description: Dynamic leases represent IP addresses that are currently in use and have been allocated to devices on the network.
dns_dhcp.lease_time_tooltip: Lease duration choices include seconds, minutes (e.g., 45m), hours (e.g., 12h), days (e.g., 2d), weeks (e.g., 1w), or 'infinite'. Default lease time is 1 hour for IPv4 and 1 day for IPv6; minimum lease time is 2 minutes.
dns_dhcp.dhcp_option_tooltip: Customize DHCP client options. By default, standard options like netmask, broadcast address, DNS server, and default route match dnsmasq host. Override these defaults or specify additional options as needed.
dns_dhcp.force_start_tooltip: When force option is enabled, DHCP will start even if there is another DHCP server in the network. Disable force option only if you want to avoid conflicts with other DHCP servers.
dns_dhcp.scan_network_description: Scan the network to discover devices and assign them IP reservations or DNS records. This operation is only allowed for network interfaces with a /20 netmask or larger.
dns_dhcp.scan_network_too_large: Scan available only for networks with a /20 netmask or larger
dns_dhcp.scan_not_requested_empty_state: Click 'Scan network' on an interface to discover devices
dns_dhcp.dns_record_location_info_description: This DNS record will appear in:
dns_dhcp.mac_binding_tooltip: Filters traffic based on IP-MAC bindings defined in the static lease configuration.
dns_dhcp.soft_binding_description: Allows hosts without a reservation, blocks mismatched IP/MAC
dns_dhcp.strict_binding_description: Only hosts with a reservation allowed, others are blocked

routes.title: Routes
routes.route_description: Routing defines over which interface and gateway a certain host or network can be reached.
routes.route_gateway_helper: Enter the gateway IP address. If omitted, a link-scope route will be created. If set to 0.0.0.0, no gateway will be specified for the route.
routes.route_onlink_description: When enabled, gateway is on-link even if the gateway does not match any interface prefix
routes.network_address_ip4_tooltip: Enter the network address in CIDR notation, or '0.0.0.0/0' to route all traffic
routes.network_address_ip6_tooltip: Enter the network address in CIDR notation, or '::/0' to route all traffic

hotspot.title: Hotspot
hotspot.description: Connect the unit to a remote hotspot manager instance.

status.no_hotspot_configuration_found_descripti: Authenticate in Settings tab to configure hotspot
status.empty_sessions_description: The sessions of clients connected to this unit will appear here.

settings.login_description: Authenticate to edit hotspot configuration or unregister your hotspot.
settings.login_helper_username: Enter the username used to access the hotspot manager instance.
settings.configuration_network_address_helper: Choose an available network address; devices connected to the hotspot will be assigned an IP address within this network.
settings.configuration_dhcp_limit_helper: Number of maximum leases. The first address of DHCP range is automatically calculated.
settings.configuration_network_device_helper: Choose a network device: the hotspot will intercept all connections on this network interface and enforce authentication for connected clients.
settings.configuration_save_info_description: All pending changes to the firewall and network configurations will be committed.
settings.unregister_unit_modal_description: The hotspot unit will be detached from the remote hotspot manager. Local firewall and network configurations will not be changed.

reverse_proxy.title: Reverse proxy
reverse_proxy.page_description: A reverse proxy forwards HTTP client requests to another web server. The reverse proxy feature works only on port 443 (HTTPS).
reverse_proxy.delete_proxy_message: You are about to delete proxy '{path}'
reverse_proxy.no_certificate_configured_title: There is no valid certificate configured
reverse_proxy.no_certificate_configured_description: You can configure a valid certificate in 'Certificates' page.
reverse_proxy.path_tooltip: Type resource path beginning with a '/' to create a resource path matching rule
reverse_proxy.domain_tooltip: Type website fully qualified domain name to create a web site name matching rule
reverse_proxy.destination_url_tooltip: This path specifies the location to which incoming requests will be forwarded. Example: 'http://destination-server:port/path'
reverse_proxy.allowed_networks_tooltip: Access permitted only from the following IPv4/IPV6 networks
reverse_proxy.port_not_open: The reverse proxy requires TCP port 443 to be open and reachable on the WAN (external) interface.
reverse_proxy.port_not_open_description: Ensure that firewall rules permit inbound traffic on this port.

qos.title: Quality of Service
qos.description: The Quality of Service (QoS) ensures fair distribution of bandwidth among network connections, dynamically adjusts rate limits based on network conditions, and addresses bufferbloat issues. Configure each network interface that you want QoS managed (usually only WANs are managed). Make sure to configure the input and output bandwidth accordingly to what is actually available to allow the algorithm to operate at its best.
qos.download_speed_tooltip: Enter the incoming bandwidth in Mbit. It is recommended to slightly reduce the measurement by approximately 5-10%.
qos.upload_speed_tooltip: Enter the outgoing bandwidth in Mbit. It is recommended to slightly decrease the measurement by approximately 5-10%.
qos.delete_qos_interface_message: Are you sure you want to delete '{interface}'?

zones_and_policies.title: Zones and policies
zones_and_policies.description: The firewall creates zones over your network interfaces to control network traffic flow.
zones_and_policies.name: Name
zones_and_policies.enable_logging_tooltip: Enable or disable logging of blocked packets on this zone
zones_and_policies.preset_active_description: When you create this zone, the system will automatically add firewall rules to allow access to essential services. You can view or modify them anytime under Firewall > Rules > Input Rules.

port_forward.title: Port forward
port_forward.description: Port forwarding redirects incoming network traffic from the public IP address of the firewall to a device on a local network, enabling access to services or applications hosted on that device.
port_forward.name: Name
port_forward.source_port_tooltip: Enter a single port or a a port range (e.g. '5500-5600'). Source port is required if a destination port is specified
port_forward.destination_port_tooltip: If you leave this field empty, the traffic will be redirected to the same port specified in the 'Source port' field. You can enter a single port or a a port range
port_forward.delete_port_forward_message: You are about to delete port forward '{name}'
port_forward.hairpin_nat_zones: Hairpin NAT enabled on following zones
port_forward.protocol_helper: Leave unselected for any source protocol
port_forward.any_protocol_message: You selected 'any' protocol, this means that ALL traffic will be forwarded. Make sure you know what you are doing
port_forward.destination_address_tooltip: Redirect matched incoming traffic to the specified internal host.
port_forward.restrict_access_from_tooltip: By default, the port forward access is granted to anyone. Add IPs or CIDRs to restrict the access only from the given networks.
port_forward.restricted_object_tooltip: All objects supported, except host sets containing IP ranges or nested objects

firewall_rules.title: Firewall rules
firewall_rules.forward_rules_description: Configure rules for data packets moving between zones. Priority is based on rule order, with the first match taking precedence.
firewall_rules.input_rules_description: Configure rules for incoming traffic addressed to the firewall. Priority is based on rule order, with the first match taking precedence.
firewall_rules.output_rules_description: Configure rules for outgoing traffic originating from the firewall. Priority is based on rule order, with the first match taking precedence.
firewall_rules.name: Name
firewall_rules.source_addresses_tooltip: Enter one or more IPv4/IPv6 addresses, CIDR networks (e.g. 10.10.10.0/24) or IP ranges (e.g. 10.10.10.1-10.10.10.5).
firewall_rules.source_zone_tooltip: Specifies the traffic source zone, which must be distinct from the destination zone. Choose a zone or select 'Any' to include any zone.
firewall_rules.destination_addresses_tooltip: Enter one or more IPv4/IPv6 addresses, CIDR networks (e.g. 10.10.10.0/24) or IP ranges (e.g. 10.10.10.1-10.10.10.5).
firewall_rules.destination_zone_tooltip: Specifies the traffic destination zone, which must be distinct from the source zone.
firewall_rules.ports_tooltip: Enter a single port, multiple ports separated by a comma (e.g. '8686, 9090') and/or port ranges (e.g. '5500-5600')
firewall_rules.tags_tooltip: Tags are metadata that help organization, categorization and identification of rules. The 'automated' tag is exclusively reserved for system use.
firewall_rules.logging_tooltip: Traffic that matches this rule will be logged, and the log entry will include the rule name as a prefix.
firewall_rules.confirm_delete_rule: Are you sure you want to delete '{name}' rule?
firewall_rules.editing_system_rule_warning_title: You are editing a system rule
firewall_rules.editing_system_rule_warning_description: Proceed only if you know what you are doing
firewall_rules.zone_no_longer_exists: This rule is inactive because it uses a zone that no longer exists
firewall_rules.disabled_rule: This rule has been manually disabled, but can be re-enabled

flashstart.title: FlashStart DNS
flashstart.content_description: FlashStart doesn't require any DNS configuration neither in the firewall itself nor inside the clients. Before using FlashStart you need to {createAccount}
flashstart.username_helper: Enter the username or the email address registered on {flashstartUrl}
flashstart.sourcebypass_helper: Enter IP addresses or networks in CIDR format. The addresses entered won't be subject to the DNS filter
flashstart.flashstart_disabled_description: FlashStart filter is available only with a {product} subscription
flashstart.flashstart_disabled_threat_shield_enable: To enable it, you must first disable Threat shield DNS
flashstart.custom_server_helper: Use '/{'<'}domain{'>'}/{'<'}server{'>'}' syntax to route only requests for a specific domain to the given server. Use the '/{'<'}server{'>'}#{'<'}port{'>'}` syntax if the upstream server does not listen on a standard port.

dpi.title: DPI filter
dpi.rules_description: Add distinct Deep Packet Inspection (DPI) rules tailored to each interface to restrict specific applications. The number of applications is restricted when the machine lacks a subscription.
dpi.source_tooltip: Only the traffic passing through this interface will be subjected to the blocking rule.
dpi.continue_typing_to_show_other_search_res: Continue typing your search query to show other search results
dpi.select_at_least_one_app_or_protocol: Select at least one app or protocol
dpi.confirm_delete_rule: You are about to delete DPI rule on interface '{iface}'
dpi.delete_exception_message: You are about to delete DPI exception '{name}'
dpi.exceptions_description: Apply DPI exclusion to exempt certain network addresses, such as the gateway or other important infrastructure, from being blocked.

threat_shield.title: Threat shield IP
threat_shield.threat_shield_status_description: When enabled, Threat shield IP blocks all new connections to and from malicious IP addresses. Blocked connections are logged with the tag 'banIP/{'<'}direction{'>'}-{'<'}zone{'>'}/{'<'}action{'>'}/{'<'}blocklist{'>'}'.
threat_shield.blocklist_description: Threat shield IP keeps you safe by blocking attacks from known malicious IP addresses. These addresses are compiled into blocklists, each with a clear name that tells you its purpose and who maintains it. The confidence score is a value from 1 to 10 that indicates the quality of the list. A higher number means a lower chance of false positives. This score is not available for 'Community' lists.
threat_shield.blocklist_subscription_description: Nethesis and Yoroi blocklists are available only if the unit has a valid subscription that includes Threat shield service.
threat_shield.name: Name
threat_shield.no_blacklists_found: No blocklists found. Try changing your search filter
threat_shield.allowlist_description: Enter a valid IPv4/IPv6 address with optional CIDR notation, a MAC address or a fully qualified host name that should always be allowed by Threat shield IP.
threat_shield.local_blocklist_description: Enter a valid IPv4/IPv6 address with optional CIDR notation, a MAC address or a fully qualified host name that should always be blocked by Threat shield IP.
threat_shield.address_tooltip: Enter an IPv4 or IPv6, CIDR notation is allowed. You can also enter an host name or MAC address in the form xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx.
threat_shield.delete_address_message: You are about to delete address '{address}'
threat_shield.logging_description: Threats monitoring will take account and show only threats that have been logged.
threat_shield.log_prerouting_chain: Log packets blocked in pre-routing chain
threat_shield.log_input_chain: Log packets blocked in input chain
threat_shield.log_forward_chain: Log packets blocked in forward chain
threat_shield.log_forward_lan_chain: Log packets blocked forwarded from LAN
threat_shield.block_brute_force_description: Brute force attack protection safeguards against repeated unauthorized login attempts by blocking or limiting access after multiple failed attempts.
threat_shield.block_brute_force_tooltip: When enabled, the system will scan logs for patterns of failed access attempts.
threat_shield.ban_after_n_attempts_tooltip: The number of times an IP must appear in the log before being flagged as suspicious and blocked.
threat_shield.attack_patterns_tooltip: Enter a regular expression to search the logs; if matched, the source IP will be marked as suspicious.
threat_shield.block_dos_description: DoS (Denial of Service) protection monitors all incoming WAN traffic to detect and block WAN-based attacks. It limits excessive traffic for specific protocols, blocking it until the situation normalizes.
threat_shield.threats_monitoring_disabled_message: Threats monitoring shows only logged threats. Enable logging on at least one chain to enable threats monitoring.
threat_shield.ban_time_tooltip: After the timeout period, the blocked IP will be automatically unblocked, restoring its access to the system.
threat_shield.banned_ips_description: This page displays IP addresses that have been temporarily blocked by the firewall. These addresses have made multiple failed attempts to access the system, indicating potential brute force attacks.
threat_shield.the_firewall_is_not_currently_blocking_a: The firewall is not currently blocking any IP addresses
threat_shield.unban_ip_modal_description: Removing the address {ip} from the blocklist allows it to resume activity on the network.
threat_shield.ip_unbanned_description: The address {ip} has been removed from the blocklist
threat_shield.ip_address_found_description: The IP {ip} is listed in the following blocklist: {blocklist}
threat_shield.the_ip_is_not_in_any_blocklist: The IP {ip} is not listed in any active blocklist
threat_shield.search_ip_tooltip: Search will be performed only on active blocklists.

threat_shield_dns.title: Threat shield DNS
threat_shield_dns.page_description: Threat shield DNS is a service that blocks access to malicious or unwanted websites by blocking DNS resolution for specified domains, effectively stopping users from reaching harmful sites.
threat_shield_dns.blocklist_sources_description: Blocklists are sets of domains used to identify and block ads, malware sites, trackers, and other unwanted elements.
threat_shield_dns.filter_bypass_description: Filter bypass can be used to avoid blocking any content on specific IPs or subnets.
threat_shield_dns.local_blocklist_description: Always block content from specific domains.
threat_shield_dns.blocklist_subscription_description: Nethesis and Yoroi blocklists are available only if the unit has a valid subscription that includes Threat shield service.
threat_shield_dns.threat_shield_settings_description: Enable or disable Threat Shield DNS and adjust its settings.
threat_shield_dns.redirected_ports_tooltip: Enter one more ports to be redirected to Threat shield DNS.
threat_shield_dns.zones: Force DNS redirection on these zones
threat_shield_dns.zones_tooltip: Traffic on these zones will be redirected to Threat shield DNS.
threat_shield_dns.threat_shield_dns_is_disabled_descriptio: To enable it, you must first disable FlashStart DNS
threat_shield_dns.blocked_domain_added_description: '{domain}' has been added to local DNS blocklist
threat_shield_dns.blocked_domain_deleted_description: '{domain}' has been deleted from local DNS blocklist
threat_shield_dns.confirm_delete_allowed_domain: Removing '{name}' may cause it to be blocked if it matches an active blocklist. Are you sure you want to delete it?
threat_shield_dns.local_allowlist_description: Always allow content from specific domains. The local allowlist has priority over the local blocklist, meaning that if a domain is present in both lists, it will be allowed.
threat_shield_dns.allowed_domain_added_description: '{domain}' has been added to local DNS allowlist
threat_shield_dns.allowed_domain_deleted_description: '{domain}' has been deleted from local DNS allowlist

openvpn_rw.title: OpenVPN Road Warrior
openvpn_rw.roadwarrior_server_description: The OpenVPN Road Warrior is a VPN server designed for remote users, providing secure access to a private network from any internet location.
openvpn_rw.no_openvpn_rw_server_found: No OpenVPN Road Warrior server found
openvpn_rw.create_accounts_for_all_users: Create an account for each user
openvpn_rw.create_accounts_for_all_users_tooltip: This action is available only during server creation and won't be shown afterwards. All accounts created will have a certificate valid for 3650 days.
openvpn_rw.vpn_network_tooltip: The VPN network is a virtual network used by clients; please select a network not used in any other firewall configuration.
openvpn_rw.route_all_client_traffic_through_vpn: Route all client traffic through VPN
openvpn_rw.custom_dhcp_options_tooltip: Send additional DHCP options to clients; especially useful for configuring an OpenVPN client to connect to a Windows network over the VPN
openvpn_rw.delete_roadwarrior_server_message: Executing this action will result in the deletion of all accounts associated with this server. This operation is irreversible.
openvpn_rw.roadwarrior_accounts_description: Users in this list can connect to the OpenVPN Road Warrior server. Only users with a configured password can use the 'username and password' authentication mode. If the selected authentication mode requires an x509 certificate, the certificate must be valid. Changes to users take effect immediately.
openvpn_rw.reserved_ip_helper: Reserve an IP address outside the range {range}
openvpn_rw.delete_account_message: Delete account {name}? Its certificate will be deleted too, if present.
openvpn_rw.renew_certificate_confirm_message: Renew certificate for '{username}'? This will revoke the current certificate. You will need to download the new certificate to reconnect.
openvpn_rw.certificate_expired_message: This account has an expired certificate
openvpn_rw.disable_account_message: The user is currently connected via VPN. Disabling the user will terminate the current VPN session.
openvpn_rw.dynamic_range_ip_message: You can reserve IP addresses to OpenVPN accounts outside the following range.
openvpn_rw.user_not_valid: Invalid user: the user has a VPN configuration but it's not present inside the remote user database.

history.connection_history_description: This page shows the history of connections made by users to the OpenVPN Road Warrior server. The connection history is stored in RAM and is lost when the unit is rebooted.

openvpn_tunnel.title: OpenVPN tunnel
openvpn_tunnel.server_tunnel_description: On this page, you can configure the server for OpenVPN tunnels. OpenVPN tunnels are used to securely connect remote networks. After the configuration is complete, you can export the settings, which can be imported into another {product} device from the OpenVPN client section.
openvpn_tunnel.client_tunnel_description: On this page, you can import a configuration file generated from another {product} OpenVPN tunnel server page. You can also manually configure a client to connect it to any device that supports OpenVPN.
openvpn_tunnel.name: Name
openvpn_tunnel.delete_tunnel_message: You are about to delete tunnel '{name}'
openvpn_tunnel.download_tunnel_message: Choose which type of file you want to download for the '{name}' tunnel
openvpn_tunnel.nethsecurity_client_configuration_descri: To establish a tunnel with a {product} client (ready for import)
openvpn_tunnel.private_key_tunnel_ca_certificates: Private key, tunnel and CA certificates
openvpn_tunnel.private_key_tunnel_ca_certificates_descr: To create an OpenVPN tunnel with a third party firewall
openvpn_tunnel.public_endpoints_tooltip: Public endpoints are a list of IP addresses or hostnames that clients can use to reach the OpenVPN tunnel server.
openvpn_tunnel.local_networks_tooltip: Local networks are a list of network addresses that need to be reachable from the other end of the OpenVPN tunnel.
openvpn_tunnel.remote_networks_tooltip: Remote networks are a list of network addresses present at the other end of the OpenVPN tunnel. The networks specified here will be added as static routes in the firewall when the VPN is active.
openvpn_tunnel.extra_remote_networks_tooltip: When the VPN is active, these network addresses will be added as static routes regardless of the configuration received from the OpenVPN server.
openvpn_tunnel.topology_tooltip_subnet_description: This method offers a straightforward configuration approach. Instead of using a point-to-point setup, utilize a subnet configuration by specifying a local IP address and subnet mask for the tun interface. In this mode, each connected client is assigned a unique IP address, and it is compatible with Windows systems as well.
openvpn_tunnel.topology_tooltip_p2p_description: Implement a point-to-point topology where the client's tun interface remote endpoint consistently points to the server's tun interface local endpoint. This configuration assigns a single IP address to each connected client. Utilize this mode exclusively when none of the connected clients operate on Windows systems.
openvpn_tunnel.regenerate_cert_message: Certificate regeneration (client and server) requires an OpenVPN tunnel restart, with possible VPN traffic interruption for a brief period. The client certificate used on the other machine will remain functional (provided it is valid and not expired), and can be replaced with the newly generated certificate at any time later.
openvpn_tunnel.cert_expiring_message: The certificate will expire in {days} days

ipsec_tunnel.title: IPsec tunnel
ipsec_tunnel.description: On this page, you can create IPSec tunnels; the IPsec protocol is supported by many network devices and is the best choice for interoperability. IPSec tunnels can be used to securely connect remote networks. After adding ore removing a network, restart the service if the child tunnels do not update automatically.
ipsec_tunnel.name: Name
ipsec_tunnel.delete_tunnel_message: You are about to delete tunnel '{name}'
ipsec_tunnel.close_action_tooltip: Action to perform after a tunnel gets closed by the peer. 'none' does not take any action, 'trap' tries to restart the tunnel on-demand, as soon as matching traffic is detected, 'start' tries to immediately re-create the CHILD_SA.
ipsec_tunnel.diffie_hellman_group_tooltip: Select a key exchange method to enable Perfect Forward Secrecy (PFS)
ipsec_tunnel.remote_ip_address_tooltip: Enter the public IP address or host of the remote server. If the remote server has a dynamic IP address, you can simply enter 'any'
ipsec_tunnel.local_identifier_tooltip: Please enter a string that identifies the current machine; this string should start with the character '{'@'}'. On the other end of the tunnel, the identifiers should be reversed
ipsec_tunnel.ipsec_network_already_used_in_local_netw: Network already used in local networks
ipsec_tunnel.restart_confirmation_message: Are you sure you want to restart the IPsec service? The action will restart all tunnels. This is required only after adding or removing networks from a tunnel.

users_database.title: Users database
users_database.database_configuration_description: Users in this database can be configured to connect to VPN services such as OpenVPN Road Warrior.
users_database.users_description: List of users in the database. Users with a password will be able to connect to OpenVPN Road Warrior by authenticating with a username and password. Users without a password must use alternative authentication methods such as certificate-only authentication.
users_database.ldap_uri_tooltip: LDAP Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that specifies the location of the LDAP server. This includes the protocol (e.g., ldap:// or ldaps://) and the server address with the port number. Example: 'ldaps://ldap.secureexample.com:636'
users_database.base_dn_tooltip: Base Distinguished Name (DN) that serves as the starting point for LDAP searches. Example: 'dc=secureexample,dc=com' for Active Directory or 'dc=directory,dc=nh' for NethServer OpenLDAP
users_database.user_dn_tooltip: Distinguished Name (DN) for the user in the LDAP directory. The DN uniquely identifies the user's location within the LDAP tree structure. Example: 'cn=Users,dc=secureexample,dc=com' for Active Directory or 'ou=People,dc=directory,dc=nh' for NethServer OpenLDAP
users_database.user_display_attribute_tooltip: Display name attribute for the user. The display name typically represents the user's full name like 'John Doe'. Suggestion: use 'displayName' for Active Directory or 'cn' for NethServer OpenLDAP
users_database.bind_dn_tooltip: Distinguished Name (DN) used to bind to the LDAP directory. The DN is used to authenticate the connection to the LDAP server. Example: 'cn=Administrator,cn=Users,dc=secureexample,dc=com' for Active Directory or 'cn=ldapservice,dc=directory,dc=nh' for NethServer OpenLDAP
users_database.bind_password_tooltip: Password for Bind DN, used to authenticate the connection to the LDAP server
users_database.user_bind_dn_tooltip: Distinguished Name (DN) used to bind to the LDAP directory. This overrides the calculated user bind DN. Active Directory typically uses '%u{'@'}domain', which appends '{'@'}domain' to the username. For OpenLDAP, leave this field blank
users_database.user_attribute_tooltip: LDAP attribute that corresponds to the user's identity. This attribute is used to uniquely identify users within the LDAP directory. Suggestion: use 'uid' for OpenLDAP or 'sAMAccountName' for Active Directory
users_database.delete_database_message: You are about to delete database '{name}'
users_database.delete_user_message: You are about to delete user '{name}'
users_database.add_remote_database_tooltip: Remote users databases are available only with a subscription plan
users_database.administrator_tooltip: A user promoted to administrator can access the administration web interface and configure this unit.
users_database.cannot_delete_database_description: Database '{name}' cannot be deleted because is used by:

logs.title: Logs
logs.search_tooltip: The search uses regular expression format.

real_time_monitor.title: Real-time monitor
real_time_monitor.description: In-depth analysis of system and application performance, detailed metrics and visualizations. Monitoring data are stored in RAM and reset upon unit reboot. If the unit is linked to a remote controller, metrics are saved on the controller too and persist through unit reboots.
real_time_monitor.cannot_open_grafana_message: Grafana monitoring is available only after connecting the unit to a controller
real_time_monitor.cannot_open_report_from_controller: Cannot open report from a controlled unit. You can open the report by accessing the unit UI directly, or by accessing the controller UI, going to 'Unit manager' page, clicking the three dots menu of the unit and selecting 'Open metrics'.
real_time_monitor.threat_shield_disabled_message: No statistics are available because Threat shield IP is disabled.

ping_latency_monitor.title: Ping latency monitor
ping_latency_monitor.description: Measure round-trip time and packet delivery rates by pinging network hosts. Add one or more hosts, including VPN IPs to monitor tunnel quality. Latency and packet delivery charts are available under Monitoring > Real-time monitor > WAN uplinks.

account_management.title: Account settings for '{name}'
account_management.change_password_description: Note: if you change the password for 'root' user, you will change the password for shell access too.

change_password.password_rules: Must be 8 characters or longer, contain at least one lowercase letter, one uppercase letter, a number and a symbol

two_fa.title: Two-factor authentication
two_fa.description: Two-factor authentication (2FA) adds an extra layer of security to your account. Once enabled, when you login you will be asked to enter a unique code (OTP) generated by an authenticator app on your smartphone or tablet.
two_fa.configure_two_fa_step_1: Download an authenticator app on your smartphone or tablet, such as FreeOTP
two_fa.configure_two_fa_step_2: Scan the QR code with your 2FA application
two_fa.configure_two_fa_step_3: Enter OTP (6-digit code provided by your authenticator app) in the input field below
two_fa.revoke_two_fa_message: Revoke two-factor authentication? The level of security of your account will be reduced. OTP won't be requested anymore when you login.
two_fa.recovery_otp_codes_tooltip: You can use recovery OTP codes if you have to login and cannot access your authenticator app. Each recovery code can be used only once.
two_fa.enter_otp_login_1: Enter the OTP code generated by your authenticator app.
two_fa.enter_otp_login_2: If you cannot access your authenticator app, you can use one of the recovery OTP codes.
two_fa.few_recovery_codes_title: You are about to run out of recovery OTP codes
two_fa.few_recovery_codes_description: Revoke and reconfigure 2FA to generate new recovery OTP codes.
two_fa.store_recovery_codes_description: Keep recovery OTP codes in a safe and secure place. You will need them if you have to login and cannot access your authenticator app.

nat.title: NAT
nat.nat_rules_description: Network Address Translation (NAT) is used to modify network address information in packet headers while in transit. Here you can create Masquerade, Source NAT (SNAT) rules, and disable NAT for specific traffic. Masquerade is enabled by default for traffic going from local networks to the WAN.
nat.name: Name
nat.address_helper: IPv4 address with optional CIDR notation
nat.source_address_tooltip: Match forwarded traffic from this IPv4 address or CIDR
nat.destination_address_tooltip: Match forwarded traffic directed at this IPv4 address or CIDR
nat.action_masquerade_description: Automatically rewrite to outbound interface IP
nat.confirm_delete_rule: You are about to delete NAT rule '{name}'

netmap.title: NETMAP
netmap.netmap_rules_description: Netmap implements static 1:1 network-level NAT, preserving individual host addresses within the translated network. This means it could map an entire private network (e.g. 192.168.1.0/24) to another network (e.g. 10.5.6.0/24) at once, eliminating the need to manually configure individual NAT rules for each device.
netmap.confirm_delete_rule: You are about to delete NETMAP '{name}'

nat_helpers.title: NAT helpers
nat_helpers.nat_helpers_description: NAT helpers are used to automatically modify the payload of specific protocols to allow them to pass through NAT.
nat_helpers.enabled_but_not_loaded_tooltip: This module is enabled but not loaded in the kernel.
nat_helpers.disabled_but_loaded_tooltip: This module is currently disabled but still loaded in the kernel. It may have been loaded as a dependency of another module or manually disabled. If manually disabled, a system reboot may be required to fully unload it.
nat_helpers.reboot_to_apply_changes: Reboot to apply NAT helper changes
nat_helpers.reboot_to_apply_changes_description: Reboot the unit to apply the changes to module '{module}'

conntrack.title: Connections
conntrack.conntrack_description: Connection tracking (conntrack) is a core feature of the Linux kernel's networking stack. It provides a full connection tracking system that enables you to track the state of all connections and helps you to manage network traffic. Here you can view and manage the connection tracking table.
conntrack.delete_conntrack_record_message: The connection between hosts {source} and {destination} will be dropped.

objects.title: Objects
objects.page_description: Objects simplify unit configuration by associating an easy to remember name to a single or a set of the following items: IP addresses, IP ranges, CIDR networks, VPN users, DHCP reservations, DNS records and domains. Objects can be used in various pages, such as Firewall rules, Port forward and MultiWAN.
objects.host_sets_page_description: A host set represents a single host or a group of hosts. Every host set can contain one or more IP addresses, IP ranges, CIDR networks, VPN users, DHCP reservations, DNS records and even other host sets. To manage domains and domain sets, go to 'Domain sets' tab.
objects.domain_sets_page_description: A domain set represents a single domain or a group of domains. A usage example of a domain set is creating a firewall rule that allows or blocks traffic to a specific domain or group of domains.
objects.name: Name
objects.host_set_records_tooltip: Every record is an item that composes the host set. Enter an IP address, a CIDR network (e.g. 10.10.10.0/24), an IP range (e.g. 10.10.10.1-10.10.10.5) or choose an object.
objects.ip_family_host_set_tooltip: All items inside the host set must respect the selected family address.
objects.ip_family_domain_set_tooltip: Entered domains will be resolved to IPv4 or IPv6 addresses.  Select the appropriate address family as needed by firewall rules.
objects.cannot_delete_object_description: {name} is in use and cannot be deleted
objects.range_not_compatible_with_port_forward: IP range is not compatible with port forwards. This host set is currently used by: {name}
objects.objects_are_not_compatible_with_port_for: Objects are not compatible with port forwards. This host set is currently used by: {name}

ips.title: Intrusion Prevention System
ips.ips_is_disabled_description: Enable it in Settings page to start monitoring network activity
ips.ips_settings_description: The Snort IPS analyzes all traffic that goes through the firewall. Traffic matching active rules will be blocked. Rules are automatically updated once a day during the night.
ips.connectivity_description: Prioritizes performance with minimal rule coverage
ips.balanced_description: Balances security and performance for general use
ips.security_description: Maximizes protection with comprehensive rule coverage
ips.oinkcode_tooltip: The Oinkcode is a unique identifier used to download the latest Snort rule sets. Register for an account on {0} to get your Oinkcode.
ips.filter_bypass_description: All traffic passing through the firewall is inspected by the IPS. Create a bypass to exclude an IP address from IPS inspection.
ips.disabled_rules_description: In some scenarios, rules may be too strict or cause too many false positives. To prevent this, you can disable specific rules. Disabled rules are not included in the Snort rule set.
ips.suppressed_alerts_description: A suppression rule tells the IPS to ignore a specific rule for a particular IP address or CIDR while still evaluating it for all other IP addresses. This is useful when a rule is generally effective but generates false positives alerts for specific hosts.
ips.delete_suppressed_alert_description: Delete alert suppression for ID '{id}' with '{ip}' and  direction '{direction}'?
ips.event_list_description: The IPS analyzes network traffic and checks it against a rule set to identify matches. Matched traffic may be blocked or generate an alert. This page displays all events related to blocked traffic and alerts.
ips.max_detect_description: Please refer to the manual for more information.
ips.home_net_tooltip: Home networks define the protected internal networks. It specifies the IP addresses or subnets Snort should consider as local networks. This helps reduce false positives by distinguishing local traffic from external threats.

wireguard_tunnel.title: WireGuard tunnel
wireguard_tunnel.description: On this page, you can create WireGuard tunnels; the WireGuard protocol is lightweight, modern, and widely supported across platforms. WireGuard tunnels can be used to securely connect remote networks with minimal overhead and strong cryptography.
wireguard_tunnel.name: Name
wireguard_tunnel.error_fetching_server_setup_description: There was an error fetching the data to add a Wireguard server, please try again later
wireguard_tunnel.delete_tunnel_confirm: Deleting the server tunnel '{name}' will remove all associated peers and disconnect them from the VPN.
wireguard_tunnel.delete_peer_confirm: Deleting the peer '{name}' will disconnect it from the VPN.
wireguard_tunnel.vpn_network_tooltip: The VPN network is a virtual network used by peers; please select a network not used in any other firewall configuration. The VPN network cannot be modified after the initial configuration.
wireguard_tunnel.warning_editing_server_description: Server configuration changes require peers to download the updated configuration or adjust it manually.
wireguard_tunnel.warning_editing_peer_description: Peer changes require downloading the updated configuration or manual adjustment.

wireguard_peers.title: Tunnel peers
wireguard_peers.description: On this page, you can import a configuration file generated from any WireGuard server. You can also manually configure a client to connect it to any device that supports WireGuard.
wireguard_peers.name: Name
wireguard_peers.delete_peer_confirm: Deleting the peer '{name}' will remove its VPN configuration and disconnect it from the tunnel.

units.title: Unit manager
units.page_description: This page lists the units configured in the controller. Here you can access SSH terminal, metrics and logs of the units. Connection status of the units is updated every 10 seconds; installed version and subscription information are updated every hour, but you can click 'Force data reload' to update them right away.
units.add_unit_step_1: Copy the join code of the unit
units.add_unit_step_2: Access {product} UI on the unit you want to add and go to 'System > Controller' page
units.add_unit_step_3: Paste Controller join code in the form and click 'Connect the unit'
units.add_unit_step_4: The unit will appear in 'Unit manager' page
units.popup_permission_title: Your browser might need the permission to open popups
units.popup_permission_description: To open the SSH terminal, you might need to allow popups for this site.
units.open_unit_tooltip: To open a unit, you might need to allow popups for this site.
units.ssh_key_not_generated_description: You can generate it inside 'Account settings' page
units.cannot_send_ssh_key_to_n_units: Cannot send SSH key to {n} unit | Cannot send SSH key to {n} units
units.cannot_revoke_ssh_key_from_n_units: Cannot revoke SSH key from {n} unit | Cannot revoke SSH key from {n} units
units.ssh_key_sent_to_n_units: SSH key sent to {n} unit | SSH key sent to {n} units
units.ssh_key_revoked_from_n_units: SSH key revoked from {n} unit | SSH key revoked from {n} units
units.send_ssh_key_description: Send your public SSH key to one or more units: this will allow you to connect to the SSH terminal of those units using your passphrase instead of unit credentials.
units.revoke_ssh_key_description: Revoke your public SSH key from one or more units. When you connect to the SSH terminal of a unit that doesn't contain your SSH key you'll have to enter unit credentials instead of your passphrase.
units.passphrase_tooltip: Enter the passphrase you used to generate your SSH key pair
units.confirm_remove_unit: The unit '{name}' will continue to operate normally, but it will no longer be managed by this Controller.
units.num_units_left: No units left | {num} unit left | {num} units left
units.num_units_left_tooltip: You have configured {num} of {max} units. Upgrade to a subscription plan to manage more units.
units.syncing_data_description: Unit data hasn't been synced yet. You can do it now by clicking the three dots menu and then '@:controller.units.sync_unit_info '.
units.cannot_open_unit_description: The unit '{name}' needs to be updated before it can be opened. To update, open the three-dot menu in the unit list and select '@:controller.units.check_packages_updates ' and/or '@:standalone.update.update_system '. Alternatively, you can access the unit UI and navigate to '@:standalone.system.title > @:standalone.update.title '.
units.warning_open_unit_description: You may need to access the unit directly in order to use the most recent features. This is due to a temporary version mismatch that will be resolved with the next update.
units.scheduled_image_update_tooltip: The unit has been scheduled to install "{version}" on the {date}.
units.error_setting_image_update: Error sending image update command to unit
units.image_update_description: Unit may be not available for a few minutes while the update is being installed.
units.scheduled_image_update_aborted: Scheduled image update for '{name}' aborted successfully
units.cancel_scheduled_image_update_descriptio: You are about to cancel the scheduled update to '{version}' for unit '{name}'.
units.packages_upgrade_in_progress: Packages update in progress for unit '{name}'
units.packages_to_update: The following packages are available to be updated:
units.batch_update_system: You are about to update the system for multiple units. The units that are available for an update are shown inside the combobox below.
units.batch_updated_systems: System update sent to the unit | System update sent to {n} units
units.error_batch_updating_systems_description: Some units failed to get the update from the controller. Please check below the ones that failed and try again.
units.updating_image_description: The unit is updating the image. The unit may be not available for a few minutes while the update is being installed.
units.unit_in_group: Additionally, it will be removed from the following groups: {groups}

unit_groups.title: Unit groups
unit_groups.page_description: Unit groups allow you to group units together for easier management. You can create a unit group and add one or more units to it. Once a group is assigned to a user account, the user will be able to manage only the units in that group.
unit_groups.name: Name
unit_groups.delete_confirm: You are about to delete the unit group '{name}'. This action cannot be undone.

unit_terminal.connection_closed_description: Connection to the unit terminal was closed. Please close this window and connect again, if needed.
unit_terminal.exit_terminal_description: To exit the unit terminal, simply close this window.

account_settings.title: Account settings
account_settings.change_password_description: Modify your authentication password for accessing the controller's web interface.
account_settings.ssh_key_description: A SSH key pair consists of a public key (shared with servers) and a private key (kept secure locally), enabling secure authentication and data encryption in SSH connections towards the controlled units.
account_settings.generate_ssh_key_pair_description: You have to choose a passphrase to generate your SSH key pair. Afterwards you can send your public key to one or more units from 'Unit manager' page: this will allow you to connect to the SSH terminal of those units using your passphrase instead of unit credentials.
account_settings.new_passphrase_tooltip: The passphrase is used to encrypt the private key for enhanced security. It should be a unique mix of letters, numbers, and symbols, hard to guess but easy to remember.
account_settings.remove_key_description: Removing your SSH key pair will also remove your public key from the units currently connected.

users.title: Users
users.description: The users listed on this page are granted control over firewall units. Exclusive permissions to create, modify, or delete user accounts are reserved solely for the administrator users. Standard users associated with a unit group can only manage the units within that group. Administrator users have unrestricted access to all units and users.
users.delete_user_message: You are about to delete user '{name}'
users.admin_tooltip: This user has administrator privileges and can manage all units and users.
users.unit_groups_tooltip: Select the unit groups this user can manage. If no groups are selected, the user will not be able to access any unit.

error_modal.make_sure_unit_is_updated: Make sure the unit is updated to the most recent version.
error_modal.report_issue_description: If the issue persists and you want to report it, please follow these steps
error_modal.report_issue_step_2: Paste the command on the {product} shell and execute it
error_modal.report_issue_step_3: Report the issue, ensuring to provide both the command and its corresponding output
